Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Mechanical and Oral Antibiotic Bowel Preparation Versus No Bowel Preparation for Elective Colectomy

Trial_Design.evidence: This subgroup analysis of the MOBILE trial, a multicentre, single-blinded, randomised controlled trial

Participants.evidence: Eligible patients scheduled for elective colonic resection were randomised

Intervention.evidence: MOABP involved mechanical preparation and oral antibiotics (2 g neomycin, 2 g metronidazole) the day before surgery.

Objective.evidence: This study assessed the impact of mechanical and oral antibiotic bowel preparation (MOABP) versus no bowel preparation (NBP) on surgical-site infections (SSIs) in elective colectomy.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was SSI rate within 30 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated with concealed allocation.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to recruiters, treating physicians, surgeons, data collectors, and analysts.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 381 patients were randomised: 217 to right colectomy (106 MOABP, 111 NBP) and 164 to left colectomy (84 MOABP, 80 NBP).

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 381 patients were randomised: 217 to right colectomy (106 MOABP, 111 NBP) and 164 to left colectomy (84 MOABP, 80 NBP).

Result_Outcome.evidence: In right colectomy, SSI rates were 7% (MOABP) and 9% (NBP) (OR 0.71, 95% CI 0.26 to 1.95; P = 0.510). In left colectomy, SSI rates were 6% (MOABP) and 10% (NBP) (OR 0.57, 95% CI 0.18 to 1.82; P = 0.338).

Harms.evidence: No significant differences in overall morbidity or adverse events were observed.

Funding.evidence: Funding: Vatsatautien Tutkimussäätiö Foundation, Mary and Georg Ehrnrooth’s Foundation, Finnish Cancer Foundation, Helsinki University Research Funds.
